title: Le Jour où Beaumont fit connaissance avec sa douleur
text:
Le Jour où Beaumont fit connaissance avec sa douleur is a <a href="novella">novella</a> written in <a href="French%20language">French</a> by <a href="France">French</a> <a href="Nobel%20Prize%20in%20Literature">Nobel laureate</a> writer <a href="J.%20M.%20G.%20Le%20Cl%C3%A9zio">J. M. G. Le Clézio</a>. It is one of the first published texts he wrote. This novella was published in book form after the famous "<a href="Le%20Proc%C3%A8s-Verbal">Le Procès-Verbal</a>" (The Official Report), his first novel which won the <a href="Renaudot%20Prize">Renaudot Prize</a> in 1963. This novella was also included in a collection of short stories entitled "<a href="La%20fi%C3%A8vre">La fièvre</a>" (The Fever), (pages 60 to 87).
Title in English.
"Le Jour où Beaumont fit connaissance avec sa douleur" could be translated as "The Day Beaumont Became Acquainted with His Pain" or, "The Day Beaumont Became Aware of His Pain", or even "The Day Beaumont Met His Pain."
Reviews.
There is a review in a blog called "The Valve", where this novella was mentioned as having piqued the author's interest because of an opening paragraph written in the same style as "Malone Meurt" "(<a href="Malone%20Dies">Malone Dies</a>)":
